_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Other Chemical and Allied Products Merchant Wholesalers
Other Chemical and Allied Products Merchant Wholesalers

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Introduction

Hawkins, Inc. is a formulator, manufacturer, blender, distributor, and sales agent for thousands of industrial chemicals and reagent grade laboratory chemicals sold to municipalities and businesses throughout the Central United States. Thousands of water treatment facilities, manufacturers, food and dairy producers, research labs and many other organizations depend on Hawkins for the chemical products they need. These products range from potassium carbonate to chlorine to FCC grade citrates and phosphates.



The facility at 3100 East Hennepin Avenue in Minneapolis has been operated by Hawkins, Inc. since July 1948.  The neighborhood around the facility has grown over the years to include: residential homes/apartments, businesses, schools and heavy vehicle traffic.  This facility stores multiple chemicals in solids, liquids and gas.  



Hawkins serves regional customers in the Industrial sector in the fields of energy, electronics, chemical processing, pulp and paper, medical devices and metal finishing.  Food manufacturers, processing plants, and pharmaceutical concerns across the nation benefit from Hawkins' chemical distribution, blending and related expertise. 



Hawkins' mission is to exceed our customers' expectations as a high-quality, service-oriented chemical supplier. We adapt quickly to the changing chemical needs of customers with a keen focus on technical expertise, teamwork, safety, profitability, and responsible care of the environment and of our community.



Executive Summary 

Prevention and Emergency Response policies:  

Hawkins' management and safety committee has set a motto of "Think Safe! Be Safe!" regarding accidents and injuries.  Support for this motto is manifested in a number of ways such as:

? A corporate Health, Safety and Environmental department staffed with trained professionals.

? Training programs in chemical safety, safe material handling, accident prevention and emergency response.

? Prompt investigation of ne

ar misses and incidents to identify root causes and implement measures to prevent future occurrences.

? Adherence to all EPA and OSHA regulations governing our operations.

? Compliance with DOT requirements regarding shipping of materials.

? Internal and 3rd party audits of Health, Safety and Environmental procedures at all Hawkins locations.



Stationary Source and Regulated Substances Handled:  

The Hawkins Minneapolis Facility is a chemical distribution warehouse that stores and distributes a number of materials used to protect public health by treating water, wastewater, swimming pools, agriculture and other uses.  The product regulated by OSHA Process Safety Management and EPA Risk Management Plan for this facility is anhydrous ammonia.   The facility also handles aqua ammonia >20% greater than the threshold regulated by EPA Risk Management Plan.



Prevention Program:  

Accident prevention is achieved through handling procedures that properly protect chemicals during shipping and storage.  This starts with DOT approved containers that are robustly designed to contain the chemicals.  It continues through having employees trained in proper safety and handling procedures, and equipping them with equipment to safely handle chemicals.  Hawkins also adherence to OSHA workplace rules as part of our safety program.  We follow industry standards, such as those of the National Chemical Distribution Association, to ensure that our equipment and procedures are protective of the health and safety of our employees, the environment, and the surrounding community.



5-Year Accident History:  

As a result of our diligence, there has not been an accidental release from a covered process that resulted in deaths, injuries, or significant property damage on site, or known offsite deaths, injuries, evacuations, sheltering in place, property damage or environmental damage at this facility in the last 5 years.



Emergency Response:  

In the event of an anhydrous ammonia rel

ease, Hawkins employees are trained to investigate the situation and if needed:

1. Call the local fire department for hazmat assistance.

2. Evacuate to a safe distance. 

 

In the event of an aqua ammonia release, the facility personnel are trained to handle small to medium sized aqua ammonia releases on site and to call the fire department for hazmat assistance for larger aqua ammonia releases.  The facility is equipped with a scrubber system and containment basin in the event of an aqua ammonia release during tote filling.



The local fire department has toured the facility and is aware of the chemicals on site.  In order to help assist the local fire department, Hawkins has a special recovery vessel on site in which a leaking anhydrous ammonia 150 pound or smaller cylinder can be inserted to contain any further release.



Planned Changes:  

While Hawkins desires to continually improve safety, there are no specific changes planned other than to continue compliance with industry standards and government regulations and our own commitment to "Think Safe! Be Safe!".
